definition: to throw oneself at/to pounce on/to devote one's energies/to flap/to flutter/to dab/to pat/to bend over
abbr. for 克羅地亞|克罗地亚[Ke4 luo2 di4 ya4], Croatia/(Tw) abbr. for 克羅埃西亞|克罗埃西亚[Ke4 luo2 ai1 xi1 ya4], Croatia

sentences.english: I want to learn how to play cards.
THE old-fashioned financial system was like Old Maid, a parlour game once beloved of small children.
sentences.chinese: 老式的金融系統就象是小孩子喜歡玩的一種撲克牌。

sentences.english: Once the cads are dealt, I'm looking for specific behaviors that represent meaningful tells.
sentences.chinese: 撲克牌分發之後，注意那些意味深長的特別行爲。

sentences.english: The current generation of portable atomic clocks is roughly the size of a pack of playing cards.
sentences.chinese: 當代的便攜電子鐘大約有一個撲克牌盒那麼大。

sentences.english: Eat three 4-ounce portions, about the size of a deck of cards, per day.
sentences.chinese: 每天喫3份4盎司的分量，大約如一幅撲克牌的大小。

sentences.english: A piece of rubber the size of a playing card has been ripped from the tire.
sentences.chinese: 一塊撲克牌大小的橡膠從輪胎上完全脫落了。

sentences.english: Let's go one step further and write a hand evaluator for poker.
sentences.chinese: 讓我們進一步編寫撲克牌求值程序。

sentences.english: A miracle will soon appear, "eyes opened wide points, sights poker."
sentences.chinese: 奇蹟即將出現，“眼睛睜大點，看準撲克牌。”

sentences.english: Sam boasted that he could beat anyone at poker.
sentences.chinese: 薩姆吹噓說打撲克牌誰都贏不了他。

sentences.english: Or play a hand of poker and flirt over your straight flush.
sentences.chinese: 或者玩一手撲克牌並通過同花順來調情。

sentences.english: That crooked dealer did me for $100 at poker.
sentences.chinese: 那個刁滑的發牌者在玩撲克牌時騙了我100美元。

sentences.english: It's playing the card you've been dealt to the very best of your ability.
sentences.chinese: 成功就是發揮最好的能力去玩轉你手裏的撲克牌。

sentences.english: Today I learned a new game called IDK war.
sentences.chinese: 今天我學了一個新的撲克牌遊戲。

sentences.english: Dog are lousy poker players. When they get a good hand they wag their tails.
sentences.chinese: 狗是差勁的撲克牌玩家，手上拿到好牌，就搖起尾巴。

sentences.english: Kind of like going all-in on a poker hand.
sentences.chinese: 如同撲克牌中的孤注一擲。

sentences.english: A playing card with ten pips on the face.
sentences.chinese: 牌面有十個牌點的撲克牌。

definition: paper money/a bill (e.g. 100 yuan)/CL:張|张[zhang1],紮|扎[za1]
to count and check/to tally/points (collected in some bonus scheme etc)
cupboard/cupboard that can also be used as a table/sideboard
to arrange/to set out/to decorate/to display/decorative items
